results.title: Seinfeld
results.brief_description: If you don’t know what Seinfeld is where have you been?

constellations_other.name: Time to rewind (The Gardens Between)
constellations_other.description: This constellation explores media works that manipulate time, specifically by utitlising a reverse play structure to tell a story.

results.description: A stand-up comedian and his three offbeat friends weather the pitfalls and payoffs of life in New York City in the ‘90s. It’s a show about nothing.
description_for_label: A stand-up comedian and his three offbeat friends weather the pitfalls and payoffs of life in New York City in the ‘90s. It’s a show about nothing.

results.title: Secret City
results.brief_description: Beneath the placid facade of Canberra, amidst rising tension between China and America, senior political journalist Harriet Dunkley uncovers a secret city of interlocked conspiracies, putting innocent lives in danger including her own.

constellations_other.name: Eric Bana
constellations_other.description: There must be something that draws Australian creatives like Eric Bana to darker material as they shoot to stardom overseas. Australia's penal colony past perhaps?

results.description: Beneath the placid facade of Canberra, amidst rising tension between China and America, senior political journalist Harriet Dunkley uncovers a secret city of interlocked conspiracies, putting innocent lives in danger including her own.
description_for_label: Beneath the placid facade of Canberra, amidst rising tension between China and America, senior political journalist Harriet Dunkley uncovers a secret city of interlocked conspiracies, putting innocent lives in danger including her own.

results.title: Scream
results.creator_credit: Woods Entertainment, Dimension Films, Cathy Konrad, Wes Craven, Cary Woods, Bruce Alan Miller, Cynthia Bergstrom and Kevin Williamson
results.brief_description: A killer known as Ghostface begins killing off teenagers, and as the body count begins rising, one girl and her friends find themselves contemplating the ‘rules’ of horror films as they find themselves living in a real-life one.

constellations_other.name: News on location
constellations_other.description: The Pye Orthicon is an example of the type of television cameras used from the 1950s in Australia for both studio and outside broadcast work. Such cameras did not have have the capacity to record while out on location and so outside crews would transmit vision and sound back to studios for recording or live broadcast.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Woods Entertainment, Dimension Films, Cathy Konrad, Wes Craven, Cary Woods, Bruce Alan Miller, Cynthia Bergstrom and Kevin Williamson
results.description: A killer known as Ghostface begins killing off teenagers, and as the body count begins rising, one girl and her friends find themselves contemplating the ‘rules’ of horror films as they find themselves living in a real-life one.

results.title: Scent of Mystery
results.brief_description: Scent of Mystery is a 1960 mystery film, the first to use the Smell-O-Vision system to release odors at points in the film’s plot. It was the first film in which aromas were integral to the story, providing important details to the audience.

constellations_other.name: Supplementing cinema
constellations_other.description: A celebration of b-grade cinema's never-ending quest for more, more, more.

results.description: Scent of Mystery is a 1960 mystery film, the first to use the Smell-O-Vision system to release odors at points in the film’s plot. It was the first film in which aromas were integral to the story, providing important details to the audience.

results.title: Saw
results.creator_credit: Twisted Pictures, Evolution Entertainment, Saw Productions Inc., Lionsgate, James Wan, Leigh Whannell, Mark Burg, Gregg Hoffman, Oren Koules, Jennifer L. Soulages and Julie Berghoff
results.brief_description: Obsessed with teaching his victims the value of life, a deranged, sadistic serial killer abducts the morally wayward. Once captured, they must face impossible choices in a horrific game of survival. The victims must fight to win their lives back, or die trying…

constellations_other.name: Australians on the world stage
constellations_other.description: George Miller’s Mad Max revolutionised movies when it tore through cinemas in 1979. Max Rockatansky’s journey dispensing justice across the wasteland in his V8 Interceptor became a cult classic and catapulted Australian cinema onto the world stage.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Twisted Pictures, Evolution Entertainment, Saw Productions Inc., Lionsgate, James Wan, Leigh Whannell, Mark Burg, Gregg Hoffman, Oren Koules, Jennifer L. Soulages and Julie Berghoff
results.description: Obsessed with teaching his victims the value of life, a deranged, sadistic serial killer abducts the morally wayward. Once captured, they must face impossible choices in a horrific game of survival. The victims must fight to win their lives back, or die trying…

results.title: Sanjuro
results.brief_description: Toshiro Mifune swaggers and snarls to brilliant comic effect in Kurosawa’s tightly paced, beautifully composed “Sanjuro.” In this companion piece and sequel to “Yojimbo,” jaded samurai Sanjuro helps an idealistic group of young warriors weed out their clan’s evil influences, and in the process turns their image of a proper samurai on its ear.

constellations_other.name: Blood, shot
constellations_other.description: The fake blood used by costume designer Edie Kurzer in Judy & Punch is connected to a long, bloody lineage in cinema.

results.description: Toshiro Mifune swaggers and snarls to brilliant comic effect in Kurosawa’s tightly paced, beautifully composed “Sanjuro.” In this companion piece and sequel to “Yojimbo,” jaded samurai Sanjuro helps an idealistic group of young warriors weed out their clan’s evil influences, and in the process turns their image of a proper samurai on its ear.

results.title: San Junipero
results.brief_description: When Yorkie and Kelly visit San Junipero, a fun-loving beach town full of surf, sun and sex, their lives are changed in this acclaimed episode of Black Mirror.

constellations_other.name: VR dreams
constellations_other.description: Since VR's inception creators have explored the ways VR could be used to enhance our lives and even extend them.

results.description: In a seaside town in 1987, a shy young woman and an outgoing party girl strike up a powerful bond that seems to defy the laws of space and time.
description_for_label: In a seaside town in 1987, a shy young woman and an outgoing party girl strike up a powerful bond that seems to defy the laws of space and time.

part_of.title: Black Mirror
part_of.creator_credit: Toby Haynes, Louise Sutton, Charlie Brooker, William Bridges, Phil Sims, Owen Harris and Laurie Borg

results.title: Samson et Dalila
results.brief_description: Ferdinand Zecca’s 1902 adaptation of the biblical story of Samson and Delilah is an early silent film, shot in black-and-white. Later frames were hand-painted to bring vibrancy and depth.

constellations_other.name: Religion, cinema and censorship
constellations_other.description: Religious narratives and themes have a complicated relationship with censorship, with creators pushing the boundaries for better or worse.

results.description: This picture describes the well-known biblical story of Samson and Delila. The picture commences with Samson’s visit to Gaza, a city of the Philistines. While there they closed the gates upon him and set watchmen to defend them, intending to put him to death on the following day. Samson slept until midnight, and then arose. Upon reaching the gates, he slew the watchman, pulled down the gates and carried them to the top of an adjoining hill, where he left them to the confusion and disappointment of the Philistines. After many feats of this kind, Samson permitted himself to become infatuated with a treacherous woman among the Philistines, named Delila. He revealed to her that the secret of his strength lay in the fact that, being a Nazarite, he never had cut his hair. After hearing this, she waited until Samson was asleep, and then having cut off his seven locks, called out that the Philistines were coming.
description_for_label: This picture describes the well-known biblical story of Samson and Delila. The picture commences with Samson’s visit to Gaza, a city of the Philistines. While there they closed the gates upon him and set watchmen to defend them, intending to put him to death on the following day. Samson slept until midnight, and then arose. Upon reaching the gates, he slew the watchman, pulled down the gates and carried them to the top of an adjoining hill, where he left them to the confusion and disappointment of the Philistines. After many feats of this kind, Samson permitted himself to become infatuated with a treacherous woman among the Philistines, named Delila. He revealed to her that the secret of his strength lay in the fact that, being a Nazarite, he never had cut his hair. After hearing this, she waited until Samson was asleep, and then having cut off his seven locks, called out that the Philistines were coming.

results.title: Samson and Delilah
results.brief_description: When strongman Samson rejects the love of the beautiful Philistine woman Delilah, she seeks vengeance that brings horrible consequences they both regret. The classic story of Samson and Delilah as told by Cecil B. DeMille.
results.description: When strongman Samson rejects the love of the beautiful Philistine woman Delilah, she seeks vengeance that brings horrible consequences they both regret. The classic story of Samson and Delilah as told by Cecil B. DeMille.

results.title: Salomé
results.brief_description: Based on Oscar Wilde’s play, Charles Bryant’s film tells the biblical story of Salomé, who agrees to dance for King Herod in return for the head of John the Baptist. Early versions were often tinted and toned to give them colour.
results.description: Based on Oscar Wilde’s play, the films tells the story of how Salomé agrees to dance for King Herod in return for the head of John the Baptist.
description_for_label: Based on Oscar Wilde’s play, the films tells the story of how Salomé agrees to dance for King Herod in return for the head of John the Baptist.
